channel.title: Posts on Ember Zhang [Code]
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Ember Zhang [Code]

item.title: Dungeons and Portals | Mount Sinai Hospital
item.description: Description The Dungeons & Portals Game is a platformer game developed in vanilla JavaScript within a Flask application. Link: https://dungeons-and-portals.onrender.com Code: https://github.com/emberlzhang/task_dungeon-portals-game Purpose The Dungeons & Portals Game was designed for the Center for Computational Psychiatry at Mount Sinai Hospital to differentiate between clinical populations with behavioral compulsions and healthy control (HC) populations. Overview Each round of the game, the player chooses a dungeon to enter, then tries to escape the dungeon using the fewest number of portal teleportations possible.

item.title: Rose Garden Game | Mount Sinai Hospital
item.description: Description The Rose Garden Game is a game developed in React.JS and JavaScript. Code: https://github.com/emberlzhang/task_rose-garden_two-step Purpose The Rose Garden game was designed for the Center for Computational Psychiatry at Mount Sinai Hospital to differentiate between clinical populations with obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) and healthy control (HC) populations. The task is inspired by the classic “two-stage” task paradigm in cognitive behavioral research. Gameplay The player plays rounds of two repeating choices followed in succession:

item.title: Spaceships and Aliens | Mount Sinai Hospital
item.description: Description The Spaceships and Aliens Game is a game developed in JavaScript (TypeScript). Link: https://spaceships-aliens.vercel.app Code: https://github.com/emberlzhang/task_spaceships-aliens_twostep Purpose The Spaceships and Aliens game is an online behavioral task designed for the Center for Computational Psychiatry at Mount Sinai Hospital to differentiate between clinical populations with obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) and healthy control (HC) populations. The task is inspired by the classic “two-stage” task paradigm in cognitive behavioral research. Gameplay Overview The player plays rounds of two repeating choices followed in succession:

item.title: Fishing Game | Yale School of Medicine
item.description: Description The Fishing Game is an application developed in JavaScript and Node.JS, and modelled upon an original version in PsychoJS. Additionally, API integrations with external services, such as Redcap survey software, were completed in the existing AWS Lambda system. Purpose The Fishing Game is an online behavioral task developed for the Powers Lab at Yale Medical School to use on clinical and healthy populations during clinical studies on ketamine, a psychoactive used for pain relief, anxiety and mood disorders.

item.title: Color Shape Task | Desrochers Lab
item.description: Description The Color Shape Task is an online web application written in JavaScript and JSPsych, a JavaScript framework made for psychology, neuroscience, and cognitive science researchers. The application back-end was built in a Flask-inspired research-specific framework called Psiturk, and setup to integrate with Amazon Mechanical Turk, a recruitment platform used for online research studies. Docker was used for a streamlined and stable deployment. Code: https://github.com/DesrochersLab/seq1_online_app Purpose The Color Shape Task is an online behavioral task developed for the Desrochers Neuroscience Lab at Brown University to use on healthy populations during research studies on higher level sequential processing, a cognitive process involving the dorsolateral and rostrolateral prefrontal cortex, potentially implicating conditions like obsessive compulsive disorder.
